title: Type hinting
snippet: Type hintingBasicamente simplifcar a leitura de codigo mostrando o tipo de cada variavel ou retorno.O type hinting nÃ£o deixa ela estaticamente tipada, vocÃª pode ate colocar que quer receber uma string mas se receber um intâ€¦ problema Ã© seu.A partir do Python 3.5!A PEP que deu origem a ela Ã© 484Mais usadospalavra_ou_letra: strnumero_inteiro: intnumero_flutuante: floatvalor_booleano: boolColeÃ§Ãµeslista: list[str]tupla: tuple[float]dicionario: dict[str, float]conjunto: set[int]Com funÃ§ÃµesVocÃª usa o -&gt; tipo: para definir o tipo de retornodef alguma_funcao_qualquer(palavra: str) -&gt; str: return palavra# Exemplo se tiver que colocar um valor padrÃ£odef alguma_funcao_qualquer(numero: int = 0) -&gt; int: return numero# Exemplo de uma funÃ§Ã£o que nÃ£o retorn nadadef funcao_que_nao_retorna_nada(palavra: str) -&gt; None: print(palavra)

title: Many to many SQLAlchemy
snippet: Many to manyEu sempre esqueÃ§o isso aqui, entÃ£o fica ai o exemploPONTO DE ATENÃ‡ÃƒOSe for criar as tabelas e a relaÃ§Ã£o delas do ZERO, crie primeiro as tabelas principais e depois vocÃª cria a tabela de relaÃ§Ã£o e insere a relaÃ§Ã£o na primeira tabela. No caso de tabelas jÃ¡ existentes basta seguir isso ai.1. Primeiro cria uma tabela como variavel# Tabela intermediÃ¡ria para a relaÃ§Ã£o many-to-manystudents_courses = sa.Table( "students_courses", Base.metadata, sa.Column( "student_id", sa.Integer, sa.ForeignKey("students.id"), primary_key=True ), sa.Column( "course_id", sa.Integer, sa.ForeignKey("courses.id"), primary_key=True ),)2. Coloca as tabelas que vÃ£o ser ligadas depois desse codigoclass Student(Base): __tablename__ = "students" id = sa.Column(sa.Integer, primary_key=True) name = sa.Column(sa.String, nullable=False)class Course(Base): __tablename__ = "courses" id = sa.Column(sa.Integer, primary_key=True) title = sa.Column(sa.String, nullable=False)3. A ligaÃ§Ã£o Ã© isso aqui: # RelaÃ§Ã£o many-to-many courses = sa.orm.relationship( "Course", secondary=students_courses, backref="students" )VocÃª vai colocar isso na primeira tabela que vocÃª vai ligar. APENAS na PRIMEIRA. Motivo:backref="students"Isso vai criar automaticamente um campo na outra tabela que contem todo o conteudo do mesmo campo da outra tabela.PRONTO Ã‰ ISSO AI!

title: How to set wallpaper on i3 WM
snippet: 1 - Letâ€™s install nitrogenUse apt for debian based distrossudo dnf install nitrogen2 - Open nitrogen and set wallpaperThis is really straightforward so no tutorial for this3 - Letâ€™s make a backup of our original i3 WM configcp ~/.config/i3/config ~/.config/i3/config.ori4 - Edit i3 WM configI gonna use NVIM to edit the config, you can use whatever editor you wantnvim ~/.config/i3/config5 - Inside of config fileWe gonna add this code to set wallpaper everytime i3 WM startsexec --no-startup-id nitrogen --restore6 - Save the changes and restart i3 WMSuper + Shift + r

title: How to enable touchpad tap to click in i3 WM
snippet: DisclaimerWell, it actually isnâ€™t related to i3 WM, i3 WM is just a window manager, it means it just adjust windows on your screen and thatâ€™s it. But if youâ€™re on i3 WM and use a laptop like I do, itâ€™s gonna be really helpful1 - Create /etc/X11/xorg.conf.d/touchpad-tap.confsudo nvim /etc/X11/xorg.conf.d/touchpad-tap.conf2 - Paste it inside of conf fileSection "InputClass" Identifier "libinput touchpad catchall" MatchIsTouchpad "on" MatchDevicePath "/dev/input/event*" Driver "libinput" Option "Tapping" "on"EndSection3 - Save it and restart your xorg session (just logout and login)

title: How to add apps on dmenu
snippet: DisclaimerWell, it actually isnâ€™t related to i3 WM, i3 WM is just a window manager, it means it just adjust windows on your screen and thatâ€™s it. However, a lot of i3 WM users use dmenu as applications menu1 - Create a symbolic link to /usr/bindmenu just show executables that are on /usr/bin so what we need to do is create a symbolic link to our application to theresudo ln -s /your_app_path/executable /usr/bin/the_name_you_want_to_be_displayed_at_dmenu

title: How to create windows 10 VM on Proxmox
snippet: 1 - Get windows 10 and Virtio-drivers ISOâ€™sWindows 10Virtio drivers stable2 - Upload your ISOâ€™s to proxmox server1 - First, click on local, go to ISO Images, after click on upload:2 - Now chose your ISO, and click on upload (WAIT FOR 100%):* You can change file name if you want to3 - Create VM1 - Now, letâ€™s create the VM (virtual machine), First, click on Create VM (Up right):2 - Choose a name for your VM:3 - Choose your windows 10 ISO, and change Type to Microsoft Windows and version to 10/2016/2019, gonna be like this:4 - Check Qemu Agent box:5 - Change Bus/Device to SCSI, Cache to Write back, You can choose your Storage and Disk size (You can change disk size later):6 - Select how many cores and sockets you want (You can change it later):7 - Select how much memory you gonna give it (You can change it later):8 - Change model to VirtIO (paravirtualized) and disable firewall (You can change it later):9 - Now, check everything and after click on finish and wait for the VM be created:4 - Windows installation1 - First, weâ€™re going to add our virtual drivers to installation, click on your VM, go to hardware section and click on Add, click on CD/DVD Drive:2 - Select your virtio drivers, change ID number to 1 and click on Add, probably is gonna be like this:3 - If everythingâ€™s correct, your hardware section has to be similar to this:4 - Go to Console section and click on Start Now:5 - Now, proceed with windows installation till you get to â€œWhich type of installation do you want?â€, Select Install windows (advanced):6 - As you can see, thereâ€™s no disk. So we have to load the drivers:7 - Browse:8 - Select the CD driver that we loaded in step 2:9 - Select vioscsi, amd64 and click ok:10 - Click next:11 - Now, as you can see, our disk is loaded (I added more 28GB):12 - Now do the same to NetKvm:13 - And the same to Balloon:14 - proceed with windows installation till get to desktop.5 - Desktop configuration1 - First, right click on windows logo and click on Device manager:2 - As you can see, weâ€™ve to install some drivers, double left click on PCI Simple Communiâ€¦:3 - Click on Update Driver:4 - Select Browse my computer for driver software5 - Click on CD/DVD Drive with virtio drivers:6 - Click Next:7 - Click Install:8 - As you can see, everything is installed:9 - Open windows explorer, go to This PC, go to CD Drive with virtio drivers:10 - Open guest-agent:11 - Install qemu-ga-x86_64:12 - Now that everythingâ€™s installed, shutdown the machine, go to hardware section and remove Windows ISO and Virtio drivers:Documentation and UtilitiesProxmox offical documentationTutorial video

title: Oh-My-Zsh! Install and Config Guide
snippet: 1 - Install zsh and oh-my-zsh1 - First youâ€™ve to install the shell zsh.Iâ€™m a fedora user, so Iâ€™m gonna use DNF but if youâ€™re Ubuntu user try APT instead of DNF:sudo dnf install zsh2 - Install oh-my-zsh:sh -c "$(wget https://raw.github.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/master/tools/install.sh -O -)"3 - Set zsh as your default shell:chsh -s /usr/bin/zsh2 - Nerd Fonts (optional)Feel free to choose your nerd font: Nerd Fonts downloadIâ€™m gonna use Hack Nerd Font.3 - PowerLevel10k (optional)PowerLevel10k is a theme to oh my zsh.1 - Download it:git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/romkatv/powerlevel10k.git ${ZSH_CUSTOM:-$HOME/.oh-my-zsh/custom}/themes/powerlevel10k2 - Set ZSH_THEME="powerlevel10k/powerlevel10k" in ~/.zshrc.ZSH_THEME="powerlevel10k/powerlevel10k"4 - zsh-syntax-highlighting (optional)zsh-syntax-highlighting is a syntax highlighter for shell commands.1 - Download it:git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-syntax-highlighting.git ${ZSH_CUSTOM:-~/.oh-my-zsh/custom}/plugins/zsh-syntax-highlighting2 - Set in your ~/.zshrc:plugins=( git zsh-syntax-highlighting)5 - zsh-autosuggestions (optional)zsh-autosuggestions is a autocomplete tool for your shell.1 - Download it:git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-autosuggestions ${ZSH_CUSTOM:-~/.oh-my-zsh/custom}/plugins/zsh-autosuggestions2 - Set in your ~/.zshrc:plugins=( git zsh-syntax-highlighting zsh-autosuggestions)Documentation and UtilitiesOh-My-Zsh offical documentationPowerLevel10k offical documentationzsh-syntax-highlighting offical documentationzsh-autosuggestions offical documentation

title: Markdown notebook
snippet: MarkdownMarkdown is a markup language similar to HTML but more simple. You can write everything in markdown. Especially documentation. My entire blog posts is written in markdown, every single documentation on github is written using markdown. What are you waiting to learn it? Hereâ€™s my notes of a course that I did to learn markdown.Titles# title 1## title 2### title 3#### title 4##### title 5###### title 6or # title 1 ### title 2 ##### title 3 ####### title 4 ######### title 5 ########### title 6 ######ortitle=====ortitle-----Paragraphtext text text__ &lt;- 2 spaces at end "break line"text text text &lt;- this, really break linetext text textExample with 2 spaces at end:Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industryâ€™s standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book. It has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged.It was popularised in the 1960s with the release of Letraset sheets containing Lorem Ipsum passages, and more recently with desktop publishing software like Aldus PageMaker including versions of Lorem Ipsum.Highlights**bold** or __bold__*italic* or _italic_***bold italic*** or **_bold italic_** or __*bold italic*__~~scratched~~&gt; quoteHorizontal rule*** or * * * or ***...or --- or - - - or ---...or ___ or _ _ _ or ___...Unordered list* item 1* item 2* item 3or - item 1- item 2- item 3or + item 1+ item 2+ item 3or . item 1. item 2. item 3Ordered list1. 1. 1.2. or 1. result -&gt; 2. markdown follow the sequence of the first number 3. 1. 3.Link[text](link)[text](link "text if the user stop the mouse on the link")image![text](path)[![text](path)](link)Table|title|title||-----|-----||data |data |can be like this (but it's not recommended):|title|title||-|-||data|data|Alignment:left: |:-|right: |-:|center: |:-:|Example:table with data aligned on center:|title|title||:---:|:---:||data |data |Codecode in line `code` code block (can be a pair of 3 "~"):```languagecode``` Checkbox* [ ] item 1* [x] item 2 marked* [ ] item 3Emoji:smile:Documentation and UtilitiesMarkdown offical documentationMarkdown EmojisMarkdown web previewFree course on Udemy(in Portuguese)

title: Chirpy Survive Guide
snippet: DisclaimerThis post donâ€™t replace the official documentation, Itâ€™s only a summary about what I thinkâ€™s more important.Change avatar pictureCreate img/avatar inside assets folderPaste the picture that you want to be your avatar picture inside assets/img/avatar/Go to _config.yml line 86, fill it with the image path like i did:Change faviconCreate favicon inside assets/img folderGo to Real Favicon Generator, upload your image and config it, click on Generate your Favicons and HTML codeDownload the generated package, unzip and delete the following two from the extracted files: browserconfig.xml site.webmanifestAnd then copy the remaining image files to the directory assets/img/favicons/Run locallyFirst clone your repository:git clone reponame.github.ioFollow Jekyll documentation to install ruby and complementsGo to the project folder, open terminal inside it and do this command:bundleThe commands above is only for the first time youâ€™re running the project locallyNow to run a local server:bundle exec jekyll sAfter a while, the local service will be published at http://127.0.0.1:4000.New post structureFolder: _postsFile name: YYYY-MM-DD-TITLE.mdHeader:---author: name: nametitle: titledate: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS TTTTcategories: [cat1, cat2] # 1 or 2tags: [tag] # Always in lowercase---Tip: Brazillian TTTT is UTC-3.Tip2: Create posts inside assets/img folderOfficial documentationGetting StartedCustomize the FaviconWriting a New Post
